CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 1, 1961, pg. 1 reads: "Last Ride for 'Clarkie' - Pallbearers place the casket, bearing the remains of John L. Clark, veteran Pittsburgh Courier reporter and author of the celebrated column, "Wylie Avenue," into the hearse for "Clarkie's" last ride down his beloved "beat," Tuesday afternoon. He died Friday, in his home.  Pallbearers were: Voyle Parker, Frank E. Bolden, William G. Nunn, Wilbert Holloway, William Harris, Herbert Smith and Lester Hood.  Members of the 351st Field Artillery, in which the deceased served overseas in World War I, were in attendance at the rites. He worked 37 years at The Courier. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Pallbearers Voyle Parker, Frank E. Bolden, William G. Nunn, Wilbert Holloway, William Harris, Herbert Smith, and Lester Hood, carrying casket of John L. Clark draped with American flag out of Jones funeral home
